page.title: 05Farming in North Staffs
page.content: Home Farm is in Keele ,which is south- west of Newcastle-Under-Lyme.The farm- house was built in 1845.There are 280 acres and the Heath Family have farmed there for three generations. Mr.Heath's main crop is grass for feed- ing cattle.He keeps Friesian cows for milk and also rears beef-cattle. Work begins at 6.30 a.m. and ends at 5.30 p.m.The cows are milked twice a day,early in the morning and late afternoon.Mr.Heath takes his holidays in April,because winter work has finished and summer work has not then properly started. The main summer tasks are converting grain into hay and silage for winter fodder.Also the cows must be milked. In winter the cattle are tended indoors ,from September to March.Mr.Heath employs two full-time labourers to help him.
